Articles.Content:
Since I learned about mechjeb, I have been making many robotic rovers to explore the moon. I have been trying to get the highest speed possible on land, and so far the highest I\'ve gotten is near 250 m/s. I am including a screenshot of my craft blazing a trail before it hits a funny bump at over 250 m/s and flips.

RULES:

1. You must not use cheapass mods that make it impossible to flip or to go insane speeds, even with the friction limit of the tires. Plugins like Novapunch, Silisko, C7 industries, probodyne, tiberdyne, etc are all acceptable. In addition, modification of any parameters of part files or plugins is not allowed.

2. The speed must be considered stable, i.e. if you flip as soon as you hit a bump at that speed then it is not stable. If you are able to catch big air and have the suspension of the cart soak up the impact, then that would be considered stable.

3. You must use a cart base from tosh\'s cart plugin, or something that uses his plugin to define the wheel movements and friction.

It would be helpful to use the info at the end of the 'flight' to assess your land speed.

NOTE: this challenge is intended for kerbin only due to its higher gravity and air density, but I think that a high-speed mun record may be even more impressive due to how easy it is to leave the ground there.
Definitively trying this. 8)

It is possible to hit those speeds on the mun, but 600m/s cannot be stable because you\'d actually be orbiting, and 1800m/s would put you at 2x the speed of a normal escape trajectory.

Usually, during the end of the burn I\'d accumulate enough force for the cart to gain lift, and then I\'d panic and crash instead of just gliding back down all anakin-style.

I had runs where I was reaching speeds of 220 m/s, but every single one of those ended in tears because of this problem.
